title: ‘Life’ ends death month
text:
Oct 24, 2015 Sarah Polley stars in “My Life Without Me.” 
Belfast — Film buffs Karen Gleeson and Paul Sheridan have programmed a month of indie and foreign films touching on the theme of death and dying, as an early bow to National Hospice Month in November, for Belfast Free Library’s Friday night film screenings. The films are shown at 7 p.m. in the first-floor Abbott Room of the library, 106 High St., free and open to the public. 
The October film series conclude Oct. 30 with “My Life Without Me” (2003, Spain/Canada), a sensitive and human story of a 23-year-old woman who learns she has inoperable cancer that will soon end her life. Although Ann decides not to tell her family the truth, she makes a list of priorities and goes about changing her life and that of her family for the better. Canadians Isabel Coixet (director) and Sarah Polley (Ann), along with American actor Mark Ruffalo, deliver an important narrative via an absorbing screenplay, based on a book by Nanci Kincaid. 
For information on the Friday series’ schedule and films, call the library at 338-3884.
